## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Template improvement
- [ ] Knowledge base addition
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes)

## Standards Compliance

- [ ] Follows Anthropic 2025 standards
- [ ] XML tags properly structured
- [ ] YAML frontmatter valid (if applicable)
- [ ] JSON validates (if applicable)
- [ ] Real examples included (no placeholders)
- [ ] Progressive disclosure implemented
- [ ] Semantic versioning followed

---

## Documentation

- [ ] Updated CHANGELOG.md under `[Unreleased]`
- [ ] Updated README.md (if needed)
- [ ] Updated relevant knowledge bases
- [ ] Added/updated examples
- [ ] Updated CONTRIBUTING.md (if process changed)

---

## General Checklist

### Before Submission

- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines
- [ ] Self-review completed
- [ ] Comments added for complex logic
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] No console warnings/errors
- [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] No merge conflicts

### Commit Quality

- [ ] Commits are logical and well-described
- [ ] Commit messages follow convention (`type: description`)
- [ ] No unnecessary files committed
- [ ] No sensitive data included

### Communication

- [ ] PR title is clear and descriptive
- [ ] Description explains what and why
- [ ] Breaking changes clearly documented
- [ ] Reviewers can understand changes without context
